verses.verse: (For the choir director; according to Jeduthun. A Psalm of Asaph.) My voice <WH6963> [rises] to God, <WH430> and I will cry <WH6817> aloud; <WH6817> My voice <WH6963> [rises] to God, <WH430> and He will hear <WH238> me.

In the day <WH3117> of my trouble <WH6869> I sought <WH1875> the Lord; <WH136> In the night <WH3915> my hand <WH3027> was stretched <WH5064> out without <WH3808> weariness; <WH6313> My soul <WH5315> refused <WH3985> to be comforted. <WH5162>
[When] I remember <WH2142> God, <WH430> then I am disturbed; <WH1993> [When] I sigh, <WH7878> then my spirit <WH7307> grows <WH5848> faint. <WH5848> Selah. <WH5542>
Thou hast held <WH270> my eyelids <WH5869> <WH8109> [open]; I am so troubled <WH6470> that I cannot <WH3808> speak. <WH1696>
I have considered <WH2803> the days <WH3117> of old, <WH6924> The years <WH8141> of long <WH5769> ago. <WH5769>
I will remember <WH2142> my song <WH5058> in the night; <WH3915> I will meditate <WH7878> with my heart; <WH3824> And my spirit <WH7307> ponders. <WH2664>
Will the Lord <WH136> reject <WH2186> forever <WH5769>? And will He never <WH3808> be favorable <WH7521> again <WH3254>?
Has His lovingkindness <WH2617> ceased <WH656> forever <WH5331>? Has [His] promise <WH561> come <WH1584> to an end <WH1584> forever <WH1755>?
Has God <WH410> forgotten <WH7911> to be gracious <WH2603>? Or <WH518> has He in anger <WH639> withdrawn <WH7092> His compassion <WH7356>? Selah. <WH5542>
Then I said, <WH559> "It is my grief, <WH2470> That the right <WH3225> hand <WH3225> of the Most <WH9411> High <WH9411> has changed. <WH8132>"
I shall remember <WH2142> the deeds <WH4611> of the Lord; <WH3050> Surely <WH3588> I will remember <WH2142> Thy wonders <WH6382> of old. <WH6924>
I will meditate <WH1897> on all <WH3605> Thy work, <WH6467> And muse <WH7878> on Thy deeds. <WH5949>
Thy way, <WH1870> O God, <WH430> is holy; <WH6944> What <WH4310> god <WH410> is great <WH1419> like our God <WH430>?
Thou art the God <WH410> who workest <WH6213> wonders; <WH6382> Thou hast made <WH3045> known <WH3045> Thy strength <WH5797> among the peoples. <WH5971>
Thou hast by Thy power <WH2220> redeemed <WH1350> Thy people, <WH5971> The sons <WH1121> of Jacob <WH3290> and Joseph. <WH3130> Selah. <WH5542>
The waters <WH4325> saw <WH7200> Thee, O God; <WH430> The waters <WH4325> saw <WH7200> Thee, they were in anguish; <WH9123> The deeps <WH8415> also <WH637> trembled. <WH7264>
The clouds <WH5645> poured <WH2229> out water; <WH4325> The skies <WH7834> gave <WH5414> forth a sound; <WH6963> Thy arrows <WH2671> flashed <WH1980> here and there.
The sound <WH6963> of Thy thunder <WH7482> was in the whirlwind; <WH1534> The lightnings <WH1300> lit <WH215> up the world; <WH8398> The earth <WH776> trembled <WH7264> and shook. <WH7493>
Thy way <WH1870> was in the sea, <WH3220> And Thy paths <WH7635> in the mighty <WH7227> waters, <WH4325> And Thy footprints <WH6119> may not be known. <WH3045>
Thou didst lead <WH5148> Thy people <WH5971> like a flock, <WH6629> By the hand <WH3027> of Moses <WH4872> and Aaron. <WH175>
